results.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Katie Robertson
results.title: Murdoch Acknowledges Fox News Hosts Endorsed Election Fraud Falsehoods
results.abstract: Rupert Murdoch, the conservative media mogul, spoke under oath last month in a $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox by Dominion Voting Systems.

media.caption: “I would have liked us to be stronger in denouncing it in hindsight,” Rupert Murdoch said of the election fraud narrative.

results.adx_keywords: Restaurants;Fast Food Industry;Consumer Behavior;Customer Loyalty Programs;Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc;Dunkin Donuts;Starbucks Corporation
results.title: Restaurant Chains Make It Cost More to Be Loyal
results.abstract: Recent changes to rewards programs at places like Dunkin’ and Starbucks mean customers must pay more before perks kick in. The companies blame inflation.

media.caption: After Dunkin’ changed its loyalty program and Lizzy Laufters stopped getting one of her two free coffees a month, she switched to Starbucks. Then Starbucks changed its policy, too.
media.copyright: Eamon Queeney for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Wiley, Shelli (1962-85);Laramie (Wyo)
results.byline: By Kim Barker and Jasmin Shah
results.title: Murder and Memory in Laramie, Wyoming
results.abstract: Kim Barker, a Times investigative reporter, reflects on her formative years in Laramie, Wyo. — and on her return to the town decades later for the latest podcast from Serial and The New York Times.

media.caption: A view of the downtown in Laramie, Wyo., a town of about 30,000, where the reporter Kim Barker spent three formative years during high school.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Immunity from Prosecution;Kasabian, Linda;Manson, Charles;Bugliosi, Vincent;Tate, Sharon
results.title: Linda Kasabian, Who Testified Against Charles Manson, Dies at 73
results.abstract: She had been a Manson family member and was along on the nights of the infamous Tate-LaBianca murders, but she later became the prosecution’s lead witness.

media.caption: Linda Kasabian at a news conference in 1970. She became a centerpiece of the trial of Charles Manson and three of his associates, and she was given conditional immunity for her testimony.

results.title: Lab Leak Most Likely Caused Pandemic, Energy Dept. Says
results.abstract: The conclusion, which was made with “low confidence,” came as America’s intelligence agencies remained divided over the origins of the coronavirus.

media.caption: The Wuhan Institute of Virology in 2021. The U.S. Energy Department has concluded with “low confidence” that an accidental laboratory leak in China most likely caused the coronavirus pandemic.

results.title: Mayor Lori Lightfoot of Chicago Loses Her Bid for Re-election

results.byline: By Tracey Tully and Winston Choi-Schagrin
results.title: Why 23 Dead Whales Have Washed Up on the East Coast Since December
results.abstract: Another humpback whale was spotted dead late Monday, floating near a shipping channel between New York and New Jersey, the 13th whale found in the two states in three months.
org_facet: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

media.caption: Whales wash ashore every year. But a recent uptick in deaths, including a humpback found in late January on Lido Beach in New York, concerns scientists.
